column1: How many years of experience do you have with software design?
column2: How many years of experience do you have with software development?
column3: How many years of experience do you have with microservices?
column4: How many years of experience do you have with software security?
column9: I found it easy to list the microservices forming the application, their relevance, and the importance of quality attributes for the microservices.
column10: I found it easy to link the detected security smells to the microservices of the application.
column11: I found it easy to indentify the urgency of each security smell and to distinguish the most urgent one from the others.
column12: I found the information displayed on a detected security smellâ€™s page useful, particularly for deciding whether to resolve it through refactoring.
column13: I found it useful to be able to specify and visualize the effort time needed to apply a refactoring to resolve a detected security smell.
column14: I found it useful to be able to mark the status of security smells after making a decision about them.
column15: The overall User Experience is good.
